clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Codeine on Driving Abilities
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Codeine on Driving Abilities

lead_sponsor.agency: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: 20 chronic pain patients using codeine are compared with 20 chronic patients not using opioids and 20 healthy volunteers with respect to driving ability measured by neurophysiological tests and driving in a car simulator.

arm_group.description: patients having chronic non-malignant pain, living in Trondheim or the four adjacent counties and treated at the Center for Pain and Complex Disorders at St. Olav University Hospital - on long-term codeine therapy

patients having chronic non-malignant pain, living in Trondheim or the four adjacent counties and treated at the Center for Pain and Complex Disorders at St. Olav University Hospital - NOT on long-term codeine therapy

study_pop.textblock: chronic pain patients driving more than 50,000 km/yr

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with chronic pain
- driving more than 50 000 km
Exclusion Criteria:
- addiction
- eyesight disorders
